solution_line_template: To determine the number of ducks at North Pond, we must first perform {ducks_lake_michigan}*{multiplier_twice}= <<{ducks_lake_michigan}*{multiplier_twice}={twice_ducks_lake_michigan}>>{twice_ducks_lake_michigan} to find the number to add 6 ducks to.
We then take this number and add {more_ducks} to it, performing {twice_ducks_lake_michigan}+{more_ducks}=<<{ducks_north_pond}={ducks_north_pond}>>{ducks_north_pond} ducks in total at North Pond.
